message_1: A cryptographic hash function produces a fixed-length output for any size input. Let's consider the SHA-256 hash function, which produces a 256-bit output. Suppose you have a message with a length of 1000 bits. How many bits will the SHA-256 hash value be?
message_2: The SHA-256 hash function produces a fixed-length output of 256 bits, regardless of the input size. So, for a message with a length of 1000 bits, the SHA-256 hash value will still be 256 bits.
